issue.title: Dialog and Notification cannot be used with Session Replication
issue.body:
When trying to use Session Replication with Vaadin, the Deserialization fails when a Notification or a nested Dialog is present on the webpage. The error is the exact situation described here:
https://vaadin.com/docs/latest/tools/kubernetes/session-replication#serializedlambda-classcastexception

This is a problem as these components are attached to the view and thus the VaadinSession and thus cannot be excluded from serialization.


Example 1: Inside a Dialog, a button is clicked that opens a ConfirmDialog, without closing the Dialog
Output from Kubernetes Kit - Session Replication Debug Tool:
`ERRORS DURING SERIALIZATION/DESERIALIZATION PROCESS:
====================================================
DESERIALIZATION_FAILED: cannot assign instance of java.lang.invoke.SerializedLambda to field com.vaadin.flow.component.dialog.Dialog.childDetachListener of type com.vaadin.flow.dom.ElementDetachListener in instance of com.vaadin.flow.component.dialog.Dialog

SERIALIZED LAMBDA CLASS CAST EXCEPTION BEST CANDIDATES:
=======================================================
	SerializedLambda[capturingClass=class com.vaadin.flow.component.dialog.Dialog, functionalInterfaceMethod=com/vaadin/flow/dom/ElementDetachListener.onDetach:(Lcom/vaadin/flow/dom/ElementDetachEvent;)V, implementation=invokeVirtual com/vaadin/flow/component/dialog/Dialog.lambda$new$76f1ff5c$1:(Lcom/vaadin/flow/dom/ElementDetachEvent;)V, instantiatedMethodType=(Lcom/vaadin/flow/dom/ElementDetachEvent;)V, numCaptured=1]
	- field (class "com.vaadin.flow.dom.Element$2", name: "val$detachListener", type: "interface com.vaadin.flow.dom.ElementDetachListener")
[...]`

End of associated StackTrace:
`java.lang.ClassCastException: cannot assign instance of java.lang.invoke.SerializedLambda to field com.vaadin.flow.component.dialog.Dialog.childDetachListener of type com.vaadin.flow.dom.ElementDetachListener in instance of com.vaadin.flow.component.dialog.Dialog
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectStreamClass$FieldReflector.setObjFieldValues(ObjectStreamClass.java:2227)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectStreamClass$FieldReflector.checkObjectFieldValueTypes(ObjectStreamClass.java:2191)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectStreamClass.checkObjFieldValueTypes(ObjectStreamClass.java:1478)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectInputStream$FieldValues.defaultCheckFieldValues(ObjectInputStream.java:2657)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectInputStream.readSerialData(ObjectInputStream.java:2471)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectInputStream.readOrdinaryObject(ObjectInputStream.java:2242)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1742)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectInputStream.readArray(ObjectInputStream.java:2142)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1730)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectInputStream$FieldValues.<init>(ObjectInputStream.java:2584)
	at java.base/java.io.ObjectInputStream.readSerialData(ObjectInputStream.java:2442)
[...]
`


Example 2: Using a `Notification` inside a component:
`
class Example extends Div {
    Example() {
        render();
    }

    void render() {
        Notification notification = new Notification();
	notification.add(new Text("Test"));
	notification.open();
    }
}
`

Output from Kubernetes Kit - Session Replication Debug Tool:
`ERRORS DURING SERIALIZATION/DESERIALIZATION PROCESS:
====================================================
DESERIALIZATION_FAILED: cannot assign instance of java.lang.invoke.SerializedLambda to field com.vaadin.flow.component.notification.Notification.childDetachListener of type com.vaadin.flow.dom.ElementDetachListener in instance of com.vaadin.flow.component.notification.Notification

SERIALIZED LAMBDA CLASS CAST EXCEPTION BEST CANDIDATES:
=======================================================
	SerializedLambda[capturingClass=class com.vaadin.flow.component.notification.Notification, functionalInterfaceMethod=com/vaadin/flow/dom/ElementDetachListener.onDetach:(Lcom/vaadin/flow/dom/ElementDetachEvent;)V, implementation=invokeVirtual com/vaadin/flow/component/notification/Notification.lambda$new$97ff97a6$1:(Lcom/vaadin/flow/dom/ElementDetachEvent;)V, instantiatedMethodType=(Lcom/vaadin/flow/dom/ElementDetachEvent;)V, numCaptured=1]
	- field (class "com.vaadin.flow.dom.Element$2", name: "val$detachListener", type: "interface com.vaadin.flow.dom.ElementDetachListener")
[...]`

Same StackTrace as in first example.


As far as I was able to track it down, those errors relate to the detach listeners that are set on the child elements in the respective `updateVirtualChildNodeIds()` of Dialog and Notification.
There seems to exist a reference loop: Notification -> Child Element -> Detach Listener -> Notification

This leads to the error during deserialization where Java tries to set a `SerializedLambda` on a `ElementDetachListener` field.


Used Vaadin Version: 24.2.0
Web container: Spring Boot 3.1.4
Expected: UI can be serialized and deserialized
Actual: Notification and certain Dialog constellations cannot be deserialized

issue.title: Change the lazyDataView.setItemCountEstimate(int estimatedItems) from int to long.
issue.body:
We are using Vaadin to display large collections of data with a lazy loader and a full pageable backend. 

While it isn't the way people should use it, we have the need to display Grids over the Integer.MAX_VALUE count. This isn't intended for daily usage,but it would be nice if this would be supported.

issue.title: Vaadin 8 grid rendering time slower than rendering it twice (empty, then full) switching DataProvider
Vaadin 8 grid rendering time slower than rendering it twice (empty, then full) switching DataProvider

comment.body: Since this enhancement is no longer needed and Vaadin 8 is not actively developed anymore closing this issue with the described workaround we have been using.

issue.title: Vaadin 8.3.1 initial grid rendering time in browser too slow in Internet Explorer
issue.body:
There is still a performance issue with a standard Vaadin 8.3.1 grid in Internet Explorer which renders the Grid slowest of all tested browser (Internet Explorer, Firefox and Chrome)
The last Vaadin grid performance issue #10232 on GitHub was closed with improvements for the initial rendering of the grid in this Pull Request: https://github.com/vaadin/framework/pull/10579

The updated sample project uses the released Vaadin 8.3.1 including the initial rendering fixes.
Also the test scenario was changed to reflect a typical list view in the application with 20 visible columns and 15 hidden columns.

Minimal reproducible example: https://github.com/FOCONIS/slow-grid-sample
Vaadin Framework version: 8.3.1
Browser version: Internet Explorer 11
Expected behavior: rendering times around 1 seconds or ideally less
Actual behavior: rendering times above 4 seconds even on fast machines

These are performance results for Vaadin 8.3.1 with the default scenario 20 columns, 15 hidden columns and 1000 rows on a fast machine with the application running locally: Windows 7 64 Bit OS with Intel Core i7 CPU @ 2.3 Ghz and 16 GB RAM.

The slowest rendering with variable column widths and additional header row containing filters:

|Browser|Grid Size (Columns,Hidden Columns,Rows)|Render Time (ms)|
|-------|-------------------|----------------------------|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|4461|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|4497|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|4448|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|4437|

Not using the complex filter row in header:

|Browser|Grid Size (Columns,Hidden Columns,Rows)|Render Time (ms)|
|-------|-------------------|----------------------------|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2802|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2908|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2906|

Additionally using fixed widths instead of variable column widths:

|Browser|Grid Size (Columns,Hidden Columns,Rows)|Render Time (ms)|
|-------|-------------------|----------------------------|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2494|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2409|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2380|

All those times taken are ideal because slower client hardware, running the application remotely and a lot more components than just the grid in the final application increase the rendering time for the grid again.

issue.body:
There is still a performance issue with a standard Vaadin 8.3.1 grid in Internet Explorer which renders the Grid slowest of all tested browser (Internet Explorer, Firefox and Chrome)
The last Vaadin grid performance issue #10232 on GitHub was closed with improvements for the initial rendering of the grid in this Pull Request: https://github.com/vaadin/framework/pull/10579

The updated sample project uses the released Vaadin 8.3.1 including the initial rendering fixes.
Also the test scenario was changed to reflect a typical list view in the application with 20 visible columns and 15 hidden columns.

Minimal reproducible example: https://github.com/FOCONIS/slow-grid-sample
Vaadin Framework version: 8.3.1

The slowest rendering with variable column widths and additional header row containing filters:

|Browser|Grid Size (Columns,Hidden Columns,Rows)|Render Time (ms)|

Not using the complex filter row in header:

|Browser|Grid Size (Columns,Hidden Columns,Rows)|Render Time (ms)|
|-------|-------------------|----------------------------|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2802|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2908|
|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2906|

Additionally using fixed widths instead of variable column widths:

|IE|(20, 15, 1000)|2380|

All those times taken are ideal because slower client hardware, running the application remotely and a lot more components than just the grid in the final application increase the rendering time for the grid again.

comment.body: Vaadin 8 is no longer actively developed and Internet Explorer 11 has not been an issue anymore being replaced with newer versions of Microsoft OS switching to Chromium based MS Edge browser.

issue.title: grid checkbox label for assistive label / accessibility should be opt-in from grid
issue.body:
To improve grid performance it would be better to disable the accessibility text "Selects row number <x>." instead of just moving them 2000 pixels out of sight if you do not need the assitive text. Also copy and pasting areas from the grid would contain the otherwise not visible (English) assistive text.

*Background*
To have nice CSS styled checkboxes we use the CSS before/after pseudo elements that the Vaadin uses also for normal checkboxes in the valo theme.
The temp fix for the accessibility label needed for screenreaders introduced with #10223 in the Vaadin grid in V.8.1.7 / V.8.2.x also breaks custom styled checkboxes that are contained in the same label.

*Problem and Workaround*
Also the checkboxes are moved outside the view area and need to be corrected by adding back the missing 2000 pixels on x and y axis.

*Suggestion*
Add a server-side option to enable the accessibility option on the grid which might improve rendering performance.

*Additional remarks*
Also as knoobie mentioned in #10223 i18n is missing

issue.title: grid checkbox label for assistive label / accessibility should be opt-in from grid
issue.body:
To improve grid performance it would be better to disable the accessibility text "Selects row number <x>." instead of just moving them 2000 pixels out of sight if you do not need the assitive text. Also copy and pasting areas from the grid would contain the otherwise not visible (English) assistive text.

*Background*
To have nice CSS styled checkboxes we use the CSS before/after pseudo elements that the Vaadin uses also for normal checkboxes in the valo theme.
The temp fix for the accessibility label needed for screenreaders introduced with #10223 in the Vaadin grid in V.8.1.7 / V.8.2.x also breaks custom styled checkboxes that are contained in the same label.

*Problem and Workaround*
Also the checkboxes are moved outside the view area and need to be corrected by adding back the missing 2000 pixels on x and y axis.

*Suggestion*
Add a server-side option to enable the accessibility option on the grid which might improve rendering performance.

*Additional remarks*
Also as knoobie mentioned in #10223 i18n is missing

comment.body:
Thanks to knoobie for trying to provide this enhancement. 
As Vaadin 8 is no longer maintained actively I am closing this enhancement request.
